section.title: Expect timeouts on a destination
section.para: In some cases it might be necessary to validate that a message is not present on a destination. This means that this action expects a timeout when receiving a message from an endpoint destination. For instance the tester intends to ensure that no message is sent to a certain destination in a time period. In that case the timeout would not be a test aborting error but the expected behavior. And in contrast to the normal behavior when a message is received in the time period the test will fail with error.
In order to validate such a timeout situation the action <expectTimout> shall help. The usage is very simple as the following example shows:
